text: A young BOY chisels his artwork into the stone ROCKFACE a the edge of this valley. An old MEDICINE MAN, his face painted with bizarre white stripes, CHANTS nearby. The boy abruptly stops his work at the SOUND of distant C Quickly he climbs the stone. Standing at the top he SEES. HUNTERS.

head_text.subj: RETURNING FROM A KILL. THEY MARCH TOWARDS A SMALL CAMPSIT

text: The tribes people rushing to greet them. Super up: North Africa 8000 B.C.

Silhouetted tribesmen dancing in bizarre animal MASKS. Fe STOMPING. The young Boy stares at the fire, SPARKS rising into the air. We PAN UP following the sparks into the sky A full moon. A SHADOW is suddenly cast across the moon, blotting it ou

The young Boy sleeps. Above him hangs an odd carving that slowly begins to RATTLE. The tent's fabric begins to FLAP The Boy's eyes pop open. He HEARS the sounds of a quickly brewing storm. Footsteps. People hurrying, calling out to each other. Suddenly the tent's entrance flap SAILS OPEN. BRIGHT LIGHT pours in through the entrance.

The Boy exits his tent, staring at the light, intrigued. storm building all around. Unnatural and eerie. Panicked, the tribesmen run in fear, racing away from the light. The Medicine man, on his knees CHANTING.  10 11 The only one without fear, the Boy pushes through them, towards the light. Tents begin to RIP from their posts in the strong GALE WINDS. As the frightened clan retreats, the young Boy moves clos and closer to the light, squinting through the blurring s A loud ROARING SOUND, building in ferocity. Slowly we PUSH into an extreme CLOSE UP of the young Boy' eyes which widen. If we could only see what he sees...
A glowing orange setting SUN just above the pyramid's pea A car drives past. Super up: GIZA, EGYPT - 1928
PROFESSOR LANGFORD and his nine year old daughter CATHERI who reads from a thick text book, are RATTLING in the bac seat.

The car SCREECHES to a halt. The passenger door opens and Professor Langford JUMPS out. Catherine follows. As they make their way down the ravine we slowly reveal t breadth of this work site. Hundreds of Arab men digging away in the sand.
Is crouched on the ground dusting off three large TABLETS covered in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics. Professor Lang walks up behind him, staring in awe.
Cover stones. We found them this afternoon.

Amazing. But why did you move them? Catherine walks over to a small table, examining other artifacts. She picks up a small GOLDEN SUN DISK; a circul SYMBOL of the sun emblazoned on a gold disk.  12 13 14 15 16
There was something hidden underneath.

Hidden? Taylor leads Langford over to a large digging pit several yards away. Slowly we TRACK across the sand, over the lip of the digging pit revealing a handful of workers struggl to secure ropes onto something hidden beyond our view. Suddenly the ropes grow taut as they begin to lift.
over twenty feet in diameter. The RING is slowly lifted o of the pit revealing its shape and structure. It doesn't seem to belong to ancient Egypt. And perhaps not even this world.
As they stare in wonder at this newly found treasure. You Catherine squeezes in between the two.
(whispering) What is that thing, Taylor?
I wish I knew.
as it's lifted upright, suspended above them. An amazing sight.
Staring, fascinated. Suddenly the lenses of her glasses CRACK.

A cold rainy winter day. Traffic gridlock. Horns honking, cabbies yelling. A grey LIMOUSINE is stuck in traffic. Super up: NEW YORK, PRESENT DAY Through the rain-soaked passenger window we see an ELDERLY WOMAN impatiently chec her watch. Unheard by us, she speaks to her DRIVER who ex and opens the passenger door for her. Taking an umbrella from her driver, the Elderly Woman ste out and makes her way down the center of the street.  17 18 19 4. We FOLLOW her through the dense traffic and up into a bui marked: ARCHAEOLOGICAL SOCIETY OF AMERICA
Testing the microphone, the M.C. adjusts the feedback as leans close to address a gathering of distinguished Archaeologists. M.C. Our next guest speaker today will be an extraordinary young man...
Clumsily this stack of books and papers are organized ato man's lap. Gathered together, they're lifted as the man attempts to make his way out of his seat, down the aisle.

(sotto) Excuse me... Pardon me... M.C. ...He graduated with his masters at the age of 20 and speaks eleven different languages. He has written several seminal articles on the comparative linguistics of the Afro- Asiatic language groups and the development of the Egyptian language from the Archaic Period to the Old Kingdom. Please let me introduce to you, Daniel Jackson. CRASH. The books TUMBLE to the floor. As he leans down to pick them up we SEE for the first time, DANIEL JACKSON, nervously retrieving his belongings.
An older PROFESSOR leans over to his companion.
Ah, another Wunderkind.
I've got socks older than this kid. Daniel makes his way to the microphone.
You, Sir. What kind of car do you drive? Daniel points to the Professor who made the remark.  20 21
My car? Um..a Ford.
A model T?
(peeved) I'm not that old. It's an Escort.
An Escort. Power steering, fuel injection. Modern "developments." Ford starts with a model T then "develops" into an Escort. The audience doesn't get where Daniel's going with this.

Why didn't Egyptian culture develop? Their sciences, art, mathematics, everything was complete from the very beginning. Why? Maybe, Egyptian civilization was not a "development" but a legacy! There is an audible REACTION from the crowd.
The Elderly Woman walks past the beautifully displayed Egyptian artifacts.
The Mastaba tombs around the pyramid are covered with hieroglyphics; names, titles of owners, lists of offerings.

The Elderly Woman enters from the back of the room, her e fixed on Daniel. Absently she fingers the GOLDEN SUN DISK hanging from around her neck. This is CATHERINE LANGFORD, no longer the child we met in Egypt.
But the pyramid, the greatest structure ever erected, has no writings whatsoever. Why? An imposing older man, PROFESSOR THOMAS interrupts.
Mr. Jackson, you've conveniently left out the fact that Colonel Vyse discovered quarrymen's inscriptions (MORE )
of Khufu's name written within the Pyramid.
His discovery was a fraud. The room ERUPTS in angry dissent.
You can prove that, I hope? With surprising speed, Daniel draws a series of hieroglyp on the black board behind the podium.
This was the cartouche Vyse claimed to have found in the relieving chambers above the King's Chamber of the pyramid. He circles the first symbol (a clear circle with a dot in the middle).
But this symbol, representing the first consonant in the name Khufu is incorrect. The correct symbol is... He draws a circle with the center darkened.

This is the same exact misspelling of Khufu's name that appeared in Wilkinson's Materia Hieroglphyica, the book that Colonel Vyse used to forge his big discovery. However, in the very next edition of the same book, they revised their translations to correct this error. (beat) The editor of this book admit his mistake but we, the academic community, refuse to. AS several people begin to get out of their seats and wal out, another PROFESSOR (#2) jumps to his feet, incensed.
Don't you think it's rather arrogant to suggest the last hundred years of academic research is a collection of lies?!  He stands join him,
I'm simply saying that the great pyramids of Giza were not built by the Pharaohs of the fourth Dynasty.
This is ridiculous. I won't sit and listen to this nonsense. and exits the auditorium. As others in the audience Catherine Langford steps forward.
Mr. Jackson, who do you think built the pyramids? There is an awkward silence as Daniel searches for an ans
I don't know. A heavy set BEARDED MAN smiles and calls out.
Men from Atlantis? The audience ERUPTS IN LAUGHTER, cueing more people to st
Or Martians perhaps?!
I didn't say that...
No, but you were about to. More laughter. Daniel SEES more people filing out. Quickl he tries to organize his notes but is clearly flustered.

If we could just get back to the subject. Perhaps their civilization lies in the buried Wadis of Western Sahara. In the Predynastic period these areas would have been rich with food and animals. New geological evidence pre-dates that Sphinx to a much earlier period, confirming my hypothesis.. But as Daniel looks up from his material he SEES the last several people left in the room, filing out the back door.  22 23 24 25
Alone in the room, Daniel stands at the podium. Sadly he slowly closes his text.
Any questions?
Alone in a crowd, Daniel struggles with his books in the rain as he exits the busy subway exit. Absently he steps out into the street. HONK. A cab slams on the brakes, nea hitting him.

Wake up you idiot! Startled, Daniel hurries out of harms way as he passes a small FRUIT STAND. The ARMENIAN owner greets Daniel in hi native language, tossing him an apple. Daniel responds with fluid ARMENIAN as he catches the app on his way over to an old brownstone building. He steps around a grey LIMOUSINE double parked in front o his building as he makes his way inside.

Dripping wet, Daniel steps into the hallway. He stops as HEARS opera music playing through an open door at the end the hallway. Slowly he makes his way to the open door only to find, Catherine Langford, sitting inside, relaxed and smoking a cigarette. She holds in her hand a bust of a beautiful Egyptian woman.
(re: bust) 14th century, B.C. Nice reproduction.
Taken off guard, Daniel walks into his apartment. His roo is a mess, multiple stacks of BOOKS line every wall, hieroglyphic tracings and reproductions of Egyptian art.
How did you get in here?
Your landlord told me you're three months behind in your rent, shame on you. Daniel puts down his drenched text books and removes his dripping overcoat.
You were at the lecture. Catherine returns the bust to a table next to a PHOTO of young couple.
Your parents?
Foster.
Oh, right. Your real parents died in a plane crash in...'73? She holds her cigarette out, requesting an ash tray.
Let's cut to the chase, shall we? Why are you here? Daniel puts a dead potted plant in front of Catherine. Reluctantly she puts her cigarette out in its dirt.
To offer you a job.
A job? What job?
Translation. I want to put you to work on some ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics.
(suspicious) Since when is the military interested in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics?
(surprised) Who said anything about the military? Daniel walks close to her, defiantly.  26 10.

In front of my building is a grey Lincoln town car with government plates. Its chauffeur is wearing a crewcut 'stead of a black cap. And the only way you could have gotten past my Nazi of a landlord was to flash some pretty fancy credentials. (beat) So why is the military interested in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics? Catherine is clearly impressed. She smiles.
I wish I could tell you more but I am not allowed.
What makes you think I'd take a job I don't know anything about?
You mean beyond the fact that you have no family, no friends, and no hope of paying that stack of bills sitting on your desk? Daniel sneaks a sidelong glance at his mountain of mail.
Well, uh, yes. Catherine stands, walks closer to Daniel. She pulls out a snapshot from her bag and holds it in front of his face.
To prove that your theories are right.
A snapshot of the tablets found at Giza in 1928. Mesmerized Daniel grabs at the photo, but Catherine quick pulls it away. She knows she's hooked him. She hands hima stuffed envelope, instead.
What's this?
Your travel plans. She turns and heads for the door. Daniel calls out to her
I'm not big on flying.  27 28 11.
Get over it. Daniel watches her walk away, then stares at the envelope

A dark sedan with a GOVERNMENT SEAL comes to a stop in fr of a lower middle-class suburban house. Two OFFICERS in military garb step out of the car and march to the front door of the house. Super up: Yuma, Arizona As they walk, we SEE a black military FOLDER one of them carries. The first Officer knocks on the door. The door opens to reveal, SARAH, mid-thirties, tense. The pain she carries tarnishes her once beautiful face.
Mrs O'Neil? Seeing the Officer's military attire, she nods, moving aw from the door.
Come on in. Sarah disappears into the house. The two Officers exchang a glance and follow her inside.
Immaculately kept, ordered. Sarah moves into the kitchen the two officers awkwardly make their way into the living room.
Uh, Mrs O'Neil, is your husband at home? She answers from the kitchen where she continues her chor
Yes.
Do you think we might be able to speak with him?
You can try.  29 30 31 32 12. Still she continues to clean in the kitchen. After a long beat...
And where would we find him?
Last door, end of the hall. The Officer nods his appreciation as he and his partner h down the hall.

As they make their way down the hall, they reach an open doorway at the hall's end. Peering in they SEE, a teenage boy's room. Perfectly kept. Sports trophies, footballs, etc. As we TRACK across the room's belongings we FIND a man si in a chair facing the window, his back towards us.
Excuse me, Colonel O'Neil? We're from General West's office. But the man in the chair doesn't turn around.
Colonel?
For the first time we see COLONEL JACK O'NEIL, long hair, six day growth, intense and troubled eyes. There is nothi military looking about this guy. He stares vacantly out t window.
Sir?

Sarah looks out the kitchen window and SEES the two Offic returning to their car outside. Sarah turns and slowly wa to the back of the house. As she approaches an open bedroom door, she stops, peers inside.
The black FOLDER laying on the bed. A pressed military UNIFORM is laid down next to the folder.  33 34 35 36 37 13. Pained, Sarah shuts her eyes and turns away.

Quickly, we SAIL over the treetops through this dense for area. At the edge of the treeline we FIND a beat up and bruised Chevy, sputtering up the windy mountain road. Super up: Creek Mountain, Colorado
The Chevy pulls up to a gate where two MARINES stand guar One walks up to Daniel's window. Daniel opens the envelop Catherine gave him and hands some papers to the Guard.
Daniel Jackson. I think I'm supposed to show this to.. SNEEZE. Daniel grabs for a Kleenex.
Cold?
No. Allergies. Always happens when I travel.

A group of MARINES are in the midsts of vigorous training Led by LIEUTENANT KAWALSKY, early thirties, big, friendly and eager. With a loud BACKFIRE, we SEE the Chevy making its way pas Lt. Kawalsky signals for another soldier to take over, th heads after Daniel. As he walks away, the others stop and watch.
Tunneled into the side of a mountain, a large hollowed entrance. Daniel has parked next to it and is struggling pull an enormous bag out of his trunk.
Daniel Jackson? Startled, Daniel turns to see Kawalsky rushing up. Kawals grabs and shakes Daniel's hand.  38 39 40 41 42 14.
Dr. Langford was worried you changed your mind.
It took me three days to drive. Again Daniel tries to lift his bag out but he can't.
Help you with that? He reaches in for Daniel's bag.
Careful, books, they're very... Effortlessly Kawalsky lifts the bag out with one hand, SLAMMING the trunk down shut with the other.
.. heavy. He follows Kawalsky into the tunnel.

DANIEL follows Kawalsky into the dark tunnel. Two large CONCRETE DOORS open to reveal a METAL SHACK, a GUARD stan alongside it. The guard hits a button on the desk and sha OPENS exposing a STEEL CAGE inside. They walk over and en
Suddenly with a loud hydraulic ROAR, the cage quickly DES DOWNWARD. We WATCH as the cage DROPS down, deeper and dee

Daniel counts the LARGE NUMBERS painted on the shaft wall as they descend. They pass 18, 19, 20... so on. Daniel tries to take it all in. Suddenly the cage STOPS. The number reads 28. The two and the eight are separated the DOORS OPEN.
Several sterile hallways lead towards us, active with foo traffic.
Daniel follows Kawalsky down the main hallway. Walking out of an open office door is MEYERS, a balding m aged scientist who extends his hand to Daniel as they wal  43 44 15.
Mr. Jackson, Dr. Gary Meyers.
Hi. Where am I?
A nuclear missile silo. Daniel turns to find BARBARA SHORE, late-thirties, walkin up alongside him.
Don't worry. It's been completely converted. Barbara Shore. The token Astrophysicist on the team. Kawalsky stops at the end of the hall, turning back to Da
This is where you'll be working. Kawalsky opens the door. They all enter.

Daniel's eyes widen. A large workroom. The walls are cove with charcoal rubbings and photo enlargements of hieroglyphics. On two large tables are various artifacts. Meyers moves over to the back wall and pulls down a sheet that was covering...
The Giza tablets have been fastened to the wall. Daniel i truly amazed, hypnotized. Standing near the tablets, Catherine looks up from some papers and walks over to Dan
Glad you decided to join us.
Where did you find them?

Giza Plateau. 1928. (pointing out parts of tablets) There are two lines of hieroglyphs. The outer edge which has some familiar figures, as you can see. She points to a chalk board next to the hieroglyphics tha has a loose translation; YEAR 10 OF KING ?, SKY, RA, THE DISK, COFFIN, DOOR TO HEAVEN.  16.

And then there is the inner track, here. These symbols, as you can see, are unlike any ever found. (after a beat) Like Champillion with the Rosetta Stone, we tried to compare the two readings against each other for any similarities. Daniel, still in awe, walks over to the translation, exam it.
It's all wrong. what did you use, Budge? Why do they keep reprinting his books?

We tried decoding and translation computer programs, used every known technique, for years with no result... Daniel erases the word TIME on the blackboard and replace it with the word YEARS. Peeved, Meyers steps forward.
Excuse me. Catherine stops him, watching Daniel, intrigued.

That's a curious word to use "qebeh." Then an adverbial sedjem-en-ef with a cleft subject "sealed and buried"... (turning to Meyers) NOT coffin. Shore walks up next to Kawalsky, together they watch Dani work quickly re-working the translation.
(to Daniel) What are you doing?!

"Forever to eternity for all time". You really should have gotten that one. Shore looks over at Meyers with an "I told you so" attitu As Daniel steps back from the board we SEE he has nearly completed the translation of the top part of the Tablets.  45 17.
This should read, A MILLION YEARS

head_text.subj: INTO THE SKY IS RA, SUN GOD. SEALED
AND BURIED FOR ALL TIME HIS...

text: Then Daniel circles the last word.
It's not DOOR to HEAVEN. The proper translation is... STARGATE. There is a stunned beat. They can't believe how fast Dani can work. Slowly Daniel turns back to them.

Alright, now will somebody please tell me why the military has assembled a team of archaeological scientists in a nuclear missile silo on top of mount nowhere to study five thousand year old Egyptian tablets?
My report says, ten thousand. The group turns to SEE...
Dressed in full military attire, his hair cropped tight, Colonel, in sharp contrast to the man we met before, is n the very image of the spit-and-polish soldier.
Ten thousand? Everyone turns, surprised at this intrusion. Clearly the others in the room do not recognise O'Neil. Kawalsky snap to attention.
Sir.
At ease. O'Neil opens the black folder, removes some papers and ha them over to Kawalsky.
Excuse me, do I know...

Jack O'Neil from General West's office. I'll be taking over from now on.  18. Shocked, Catherine turns to Kawalsky who looks up at the papers and nods; it's true. Daniel could care less about the changing of the guard and steps forward.
Wait a minute. Ten thousand? That's impossible. Egyptian civilization didn't even exist until...

We know, but the sonic and Radiocarbon tests are conclusive. Look at these artifacts from associated and overlying strata. Clearly Epipaleolithic or Neolithic, probably related to the Natufian in Palestine. Entirely consistent with the Ninth to Tenth Millennium B.C. date.
These are cover stones. Was there a tomb underneath?
No. But we found something much more interesting. O'Neil interrupts, stepping between them.
Excuse me, but this information has become classified.
(confused) Catherine, what's going on here?
I'm not sure.
From now on, no information will be passed on to non military personnel without my expressed permission.
You can't be serious. This is ludicrous. What the hell am I doing here?
You're a translator, so translate. Lieutenant, I want all information not directly pertaining to these tablets to be removed and brought to my office immediately.  46 19. O'Neil turns for the exit.
Your office, Sir?
(turning back) And I'll need an office.
Yes Sir! Kawalsky rushes for the door and leads O'Neil out. O'Neil marches out. The group exchange confused glances.
Who is this guy?
I'll handle this. Catherine goes running after O'Neil. Meyers and Shore exi behind her leaving a confused Daniel alone with the Table
(to himself) Ten thousand?
Kawalsky leads O'Neil down the hallway. From the rear, Catherine rushes to catch up.
Colonel, just a minute. (O'Neil stops) I think you owe me some kind of explanation. I was told I'd have complete autonomy.
Plans change.
Why?
Things have gotten too loose around here. You've even brought in another civilian.
Jackson was approved.  47 20.
To translate. That's all.
This has nothing to do with Jackson, does it? What's this all about? why did they bring you in? At first he doesn't want to answer. Finally he decides to tell her the truth.
I'm here in case you succeed. O'Neil turns and walks away.

To the strains of seventeenth century opera music pouring out of a ghetto blaster, we PAN across the darkened lab. Daniel's belongings are spread throughout the room, inclu his Egyptian bust. Open books scattered all over the floo The room is a mess. AS we see the Tablets, we TRACK UP the scaffolding surrou it until we find Daniel, laying by the top of the Tablets Daniel, looking harried and tired, is deep in thought.
Do you have a problem with the food here? You've barely eaten in days. Daniel leans over the edge of the scaffolding and SEES Kawalsky standing below, a tray of food in his hands.
You want anything else?
A point of reference. Some context. You want me to solve a puzzle but you won't give me the clues.
You know I'm under strict orders.
So disobey orders. You know what Shakespeare said, "Let them obey that know not how to rule." Kawalsky calmly puts the tray of food down on the desk  48 49 50 51 21.

Must be tough to always be the smartest person in the room. Kawalsky turns and exits. Frustrated, Daniel lays back do onto the scaffolding. Daniel rolls over and climbs down the scaffolding and wal over to a table. He grabs the coffee pot only to find it empty. Carrying the pot with him, Daniel exits the lab.
Just as he steps out of the lab, a NIGHT WATCHMAN looks u from his post. Daniel holds the empty pot up.
Out of water. The Watchman nods as Daniel moves down the hall.

Turning the corner, pot in hand, Daniel passes O'Neil's office; O'Neil's name freshly painted on the door. Checki to see that he's unobserved, Daniel walks up to the offic door. Daniel examines a KEYPAD at the side of the door. He reac into his pocket and pulls out a small pair of nail clippe He jimmies the top of the pad open with the clippers and jams them into the wiring, SPARKS jump. Suddenly the offi door glides OPEN.

Like his home, O'Neil's office is immaculately kept. Dani creeps inside, scanning the room. He SEES a file cabinet and rushes over to it. But as he opens its drawers he finds they are all empty. Daniel opens the closet door and finds a large SAFE, very high security. He looks down at the tiny nail clippers st in his hand. No way. Casually Daniel goes through the desk drawers, but again, empty. Finally in the last drawer he finds a photo of O'Neil's wife and son. Suddenly the GLOW of a computer sc catches his eye. Daniel picks up the keyboard and starts typing.

Below the words, UNITED STATES ARMED FORCES, Daniel types the word "query" a highlight list appears. Daniel moves t highlight over the word PERSONNEL. The word SEARCH appear  52 53 54 55 22. Daniel types in COLONEL JACK O'NEIL. The computer respond PLEASE WAIT... Impatiently Daniel waits. Suddenly the SHADOW of a guard SEEN through the door. Daniel FREEZES. The guard passes. Daniel looks back down to the computer and sees...

Daniel types something into the computer but the only res he gets is; CLASSIFIED. Frustrated, Daniel shuts the desktop and moves towards th exit. But just as he's about to walk out the door, he spo something on the wall, back up.
of the known universe. Several of the star constellations marked out in white. Daniel reaches up and the Star Map gets violently RIPPED from the wall.
A bar of WHITE LIGHT scans across the table top, over the STAR MAP.
Stuffing his face with a SNICKERS BAR, DANIEL sits behind the bank of computers, working furiously.

The screen FILLS with the image of one of the hieroglyphi We PAN UP from the computer to see it on the TABLETS just beyond the screen. Quickly Daniel punches something up on the computer. The computer screen SPLITS putting the image of the hieroglyp on one side and the map's ORION star constellation on the other. Making some adjustments on the computer, Daniel ROTATES t image from the Star Map until it forms the SAME SHAPE AS HIEROGLYPHIC. They are, in fact, the same symbol! Daniel turns to his Egyptian bust.
Bingo!
Sliding to a stop. Dust. Doors opening. Stepping out of the limos we SEE a DOZEN high ranking military OFFICIALS.
The group of OFFICIALS move towards the tunnel entrance. they march we see that they surround GENERAL WEST, 50's. The group disappears inside.
Kawalsky leads Daniel, who carries a stack of papers, dow the hall. Kawalsky stops, opens a door marked BRIEFING RO Daniel enters.

The Briefing room is packed; O'Neil, Catherine, Meyers, S and all the OFFICIALS we saw entering the compound. At th center of the conversation is General West. Daniel clearly wasn't expecting such an audience.
Daniel, I'd like you to meet General West.
I've come a long way to hear this. Let's see what you've got. Daniel turns to Catherine who nods for Daniel to go ahead Daniel unfurls O'Neil's star map. Daniel circles one of t constellations.
This is a star constellation. Orion. Identical to a symbol on the Tablets. The scientists exchange interested looks.
The symbols on the Tablets were not words. They were constellations. Put together in a meticulous and unique order, forming an address.
An "address"? You mean coordinates?
Exactly. The centerpiece of the tablets holds the key. 56 57 58 59  24. Daniel draws the cartouche. Shore, Meyers and Catherine exchange a look. Even O'Neil leans forward.
This cartouche is a map. What we have here are the seven points to outline a course to a destination.
Seven? Daniel draws a diagram indicating the six points needed t determine a destination (SEE DIAGRAM).

In order to find a destination in any three dimensional space we need to find two points to determine exact height, two points for width, and two points for depth. Those points are indicated here... (re: cartouche) ...with star constellations.
You said you needed seven points?
Yes. While these symbols give us our destination, in order to chart our course we must have a point of origin.
But there are only six symbols on the cartouche.
That's because the point of origin is not inside the cartouche but below it, here. Daniel circles a small symbol at the base of the cartouch
This here. This is the sign for Earth. The point of origin. The seventh symbol. There is a long silence. Daniel waits for a response. It is long in coming.
(sly smile) He did it.  60 61 25.
Did what?
There is no symbol like that on the device.
Perhaps some other kind of representation?
What device? Catherine turns to O'Neil and General.
You'll have to show him. He's the only one who can identify it.
Would someone please tell me what's going on? The General thinks a moment, turns to O'Neil.

Show him. O'Neil walks over to the back wall. He pushes a large BUT Suddenly the whole WALL SLIDES AWAY revealing a huge bay window looking out at a much larger room below. Surprised, Daniel turns. As Daniel walks over to the wind we PUSH IN TO SEE...
Through the window we can see the converted missile silo packed with high tech equipment. In the center of all thi technology sits...
This ring, the same one found in Egypt over sixty years a now seems to be part of one gigantic functioning machine.
What the hell is that?
Your "Star Gate."
Take him downstairs. See if he can identify this "seventh symbol."  62 63 64 26. Catherine nods and leads Daniel and the others out of the room, down to the silo. O'Neil and the General stay behin
Controlled chaos. This room looks much like "mission control." Catherine escorts Daniel into the control booth He stares at the ring in total awe.

While we didn't realize the symbols were star constellations, it was obvious to us that they match symbols written on the star gate. Problem was, we never knew about the seventh symbol. Through the observation window above, O'Neil and General West watch as a video camera moves across a TRACK closing on the details of the Star Gate. General West turns to O'Neil.
Jack, it's good to have you back. (O'Neil nods) How's your wife?
Some days are alright, others aren't. The General nods, understands.
Catherine leads Daniel next to a MONITOR that shows a det of the symbols written on the rim of the star gate. Danie stares at the screen, watching the symbols pass as the ri slowly rotates.
Hold it! Catherine turns, signals for the Star Gate to stop spinni Daniel walks closer to the monitor.
Lifting a black marker to the screen, Daniel draws the sy he found below the cartouche OVER a symbol seen on the sc Clearly this symbol is the other representation of the sa sign.
That's it. We must have been blind!
Let's try it.  65 27. Catherine picks up a phone. Above we SEE General West pic up a phone from behind the observation glass. He nods. Catherine hangs up.

(announcing) Let's run a test. Over a Mic, Shore gives instructions to two TECNICIANS wh program the ring to TURN, front part and back in differen directions, aligning the sides. Each section stopping at particular sign, matching the cartouche. Several ARMED GUARDS suddenly surround the star gate, protecting it, from what, we don't know. A Technician ope the top of the probe and places a caged RAT inside. As each symbol aligns on the StarGate, a LASER ignites in the center of the ring. Each additional laser builds the intensity of the light. Daniel is amazed. He adjusts his glasses to get a better look when they suddenly CRACK.
I should have warned you about that.
(taking off his glasses) Incredible. As the Seventh Symbol is matched up, there is an audible HUM. The lasers BRIGHTEN and a strange light TUNNEL begin to form at the center of the ring.

It's guiding itself. Can you believe this?! Suddenly every computer in the room begins to activate. Lights FLASH, data PRINTS out, technicians rush to deal w all the input. Shore turns around to SEE...

head_text.subj: MAP ON THE BACK WALL OF THE CONTROL ROOM 65

text: A detailed schematic of the Universe. A small red laser CROSS HAIR begins to trek across the map, leaving Earth a traveling across the galaxy, stopping at the far end of t screen.
Oh my God, the beam has locked onto a point on the other side of our Galaxy!
It has mass. Could be a moon or large asteroid.  28.
Where are we on that map?
